newsitem.title: UK: GKN forms Thai drive shaft joint venture.
newsitem.headline: GKN forms Thai drive shaft joint venture.

text.p: British engineering and agriculture technology group GKN Plc said on Thursday it formed a drive shaft joint venture in Thailand.
The venture, GKN Driveshafts (Thailand) based in Rayong Province, will be 51-percent-owned by a unit of GKN, with the remaining equity held by its Thai partners, Concept Management Co Ltd.
The venture's total investment over the next three years was expected to be about 15 million stg, with its turnover seen reaching 20 million stg per year by 2000, GKN said in a statement.
GKN said the venture would focus initially on supplying constant velocity drive shafts to the Thai assembly plants of major international car makers. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
